title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, gather requirements from stakeholders, and create a detailed project plan.

title: System Architecture Design for ClimateChangeModelingTool
description:
Design the overall system architecture, including components, data flow, integration points, and infrastructure requirements. The design will focus on microservices for modularity, containerization using Docker or Kubernetes for scalability, data storage solutions like MongoDB or PostgreSQL considering both performance and data integrity, API and UI design, security measures such as encryption and authentication, monitoring and logging systems, CI/CD pipelines for efficient deployment, and documentation of the architecture design. Potential challenges and proposed mitigation strategies will also be included. The following is a high-level overview of the architecture (including diagrams if possible). Detailed descriptions of each component will focus on: 
1. Microservices design for modularity
2. Containerization using Docker or Kubernetes for scalability
3. Data storage solutions like MongoDB or PostgreSQL considering both performance and data integrity
4. API and UI design
5. Security measures such as encryption and authentication
6. Monitoring and logging systems
7. CI/CD pipelines for efficient deployment
8. Documentation of the architecture design.

title: Data Modeling and Database Design for ClimateChangeModelingTool
description: Design the data model and database schema to store climate data, simulation parameters, and simulation results. The design should consider the following requirements: 1) Support for storing large volumes of time-series data from various sources (weather stations, satellites, etc.). 2) Efficient querying and retrieval of data for analysis and visualization. 3) Ability to store and retrieve simulation configurations and results. 4) Scalability to handle increasing data volumes over time. Additional considerations include data normalization, data versioning, data security, and implementing a system for efficient data backup and disaster recovery. To ensure scalability, the design should also consider the use of NoSQL databases or partitioning strategies. The RFC is seeking code-architect's review.

title: Climate Modeling and Simulation Engine
description: Develop the core climate modeling and simulation engine based on scientific models and algorithms.

title: User Interface and Visualization
description: Design and develop the user interface for configuring simulations, visualizing results, and exploring data.

title: Security and Access Control (Revised)
description: Implement secure access control, authentication, authorization, and data protection mechanisms. Include roles such as administrator, researcher, public user with appropriate permissions, as well as define the permissions for each role in detail. Also, consider implementing a two-factor authentication system to enhance security.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop and execute test plans, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the deployment infrastructure, automate deployments, implement monitoring, logging, and security best practices. This task also includes setting up continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and will involve collaboration with the System Architecture Design team for optimized resource allocation and scalability.

title: Documentation and User Support
description: Create comprehensive documentation, user guides, and provide support channels for users.
